sentences.text: Some special Slovak/Czech chars like "" are missing in internally opened PDB files and during conversion there is same issue about Central European charset (cp1252 I believe or ISO 8859-2).
Attach the file.
PODKOVN
Karen Andersenov, kter opt poskytla neocenitelnou pomoc s mmi podivnmi jazyky a histori.
Jej prce na posledn kapitole Eonu poloila vtinu zkladnch kamen Oikoumen v tomto pokraovn.
Adriene-Martin Barnesov za zapjen velmi uitenho vdeckho materilu;
na vlastn riziko jsem ignoroval jej poznatky o architektue Rhodesu, abych mohl demonstrovat hlubok historick zmny na Rhodosu.
Brianu Thomsenovi, vynikajcmu redaktorovi, kter vil, dvoval a riskoval a tak staten bojoval za to, aby moje prza nepokulhvala.
Tyto dobr lidi z nieho nevite;
za vechny chyby v tto knize mohu pouze j - nebo mon mj pota.
This is a PalmDOC PDB file.
This type of PDB does not specify a character encoding.
You need to specify it manually when converting.
The viewer does not support specifying an ecoding.
You would need to first convert to a format like EPUB that includes this information and use calibre's viewer with EPUB if you want to read with calibre's viewer.
I see....
can I have some comments about items I noticed while using Calibre(or where to post them to add hand to improve it)?:
1. Is it common to misinterpret almost all books during "add" procedure? Or is it just because all my books are in CZ/SK lang.? If so I have a few suggestions...

- I have original files stored by directory system <Author Surname char>\<Author>\<Book name (sometimes like "Author - Name")> ...I mean - can u use subdirectories to specify Author by name of folder with books...

- Name could be missing in filename but most books have Author and Book name noted in very first lines of file itself! Also some of them contain ISBN somewhere in first paragraphs - maybe U could try to search first 2 paragraphs for it....

- Moreover - for country like mine its hard to find book/cover/comments on sites of google or amazon, but surely you could somehow make Calibre obtain at least English cover/comment and other information but leave title and language to its true language... Maybe using google translatefor search english title? :)) I know - not all titles are translated literally and there could be more synonimous but just think about it ;)
- And to this encoding issue - maybe U could add users preffered book language or something to guess/or manually choose correct encoding for reading ;)
Thank you very much for clearing my troubble issue :)
